page.title: 16Finedon Farming
page.content: Most of the farms around Finedon are arable farms.The main crop is wheat of which 2 varieties are grown.1 for bread and 1 for cattle food.Barley's also grown for cattle food.More and more land is being used to grow rape for its oil used in many products such as margarine. Townside Farm (466 acres) is mainly arable.A few cattle are bought in for fattening.Scotch half breed sheep are kept.Shearing is done by the 3 farm workers. Busiest time of the year is harvest when the crops have to be reaped and dried before storage. The biggest change in farming has been the change from horse drawn implements to the complex machinery of today.
